title: To Kill a Mockingbird: Banned for Anti-Racism
description: A micro-lesson that makes To Kill a Mockingbird: Banned for Anti-Racism usable.

hook.text: America's most beloved anti-racist novel is one of its most frequently banned books. The irony cuts deep.

buildup.text: Harper Lee's 1960 novel follows a lawyer defending a Black man falsely accused of rape in the segregated South.

discovery.text: It's been challenged for racial slurs, discussions of rape, and for making some readers uncomfortable about racism.

twist.text: Both conservatives and progressives have sought to remove it â€” some say it uses a white savior narrative.

climax.text: The novel remains the most widely taught book in American schools â€” surviving every challenge thrown at it.

punchline.text: A book about injustice keeps getting judged unfairly.

quiz.question: Why has To Kill a Mockingbird been challenged by both conservatives and progressives?
options: For racial slurs and for using a white savior narrative
